sourcing.instructions: Ac: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; Bi: Metal suppliers or online retailers; Hg: Specialty chemical suppliers, ensuring proper handling due to toxicity.
steps: Ac: Chemical supply stores or online chemical suppliers; Bi: Metal suppliers or online retailers; Hg: Specialty chemical suppliers, ensuring proper handling due to toxicity.

1. Measure 45.0 g of Ac. 2. Measure 90.0 g of Bi. 3. Measure 15.0 g of Hg. 4. Combine Ac and Bi in a clean glass container. 5. Stir the mixture gently for 5 minutes until uniform. 6. Carefully add Hg to the mixture while stirring. 7. Continue mixing for an additional 5 minutes until fully integrated.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Measure 45.0 g of Ac. 2. Measure 90.0 g of Bi. 3. Measure 15.0 g of Hg. 4. Combine Ac and Bi in a clean glass container. 5. Stir the mixture gently for 5 minutes until uniform. 6. Carefully add Hg to the mixture while stirring. 7. Continue mixing for an additional 5 minutes until fully integrated.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixture to a heat-resistant container. 2. Heat the mixture to a temperature of 150°C (302°F) for 30 minutes to ensure full reaction and uniformity.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixture to a heat-resistant container. 2. Heat the mixture to a temperature of 150°C (302°F) for 30 minutes to ensure full reaction and uniformity.

steps: 1. Remove the container from heat. 2. Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature (approximately 25°C or 77°F) for about 1 hour in a well-ventilated area.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Remove the container from heat. 2. Allow the mixture to cool to room temperature (approximately 25°C or 77°F) for about 1 hour in a well-ventilated area.

steps: 1. Once cooled, pour the mixture into a mold with dimensions 3 inches x 2 inches x 7 inches. 2. Allow the material to cure for 24 hours at room temperature. 3. After curing, remove from the mold and sand any rough edges for a smooth finish. 4. Optionally, seal the surface with a protective coating to enhance durability.
